what: A note on spatiotemporally aggregated climate data without further transformations
title: Spatiotemporal Aggregation for Climate Data
text: desired, user can employ stagg return spatiotemporally aggregated climate data without transformations using staggregate_polynomial() function. column order_1 represents first order polynomial, .e., merely spatiotemporal means (sums) input climate data. temporal aggregation dictated user-defined arguments daily_agg (options “sum” “average”, “none”) time_agg (options “hour”, “day”, “month”, “year”). spatial aggregation occurs user-defined administrative areas interests (e.g., counties), incorporated overlay_weights input generated overlay_weights() function. user can set argument degree = 1 desired output. However, important note aggregation bias can become severe aggregations taken large spatial /temporal periods nonlinear transformations performed. Indeed, main feature stagg package performs transformations aggregations sequence avoids aggregation bias. Thus, users cautioned performing transformations aggregation. Users wish use transformations encouraged submit package via issue pull request GitHub future package integration.
